comments:
On CDT 1.2 RC0 on Solaris (untested on other platforms).

1. Create a Managed Make project (C, Solaris Executable)

2. Add an include path via Project properties > C/C++ Build
> Compiler > Directories > Include Paths > New...
An "Enter Value" dialog appears, prompting for an Include path.

3. Your copy buffer is empty, so you cancel the dialog.
The dialog disappears, but:
Console from which Eclipse was launched gets:
"Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
Reason:
java.lang.NullPointerException"

workspace/.metadata/.log file contains:
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at 
org.eclipse.cdt.managedbuilder.ui.properties.BuildOptionListFieldEditor.getNewIn
putObject(BuildOptionListFieldEditor.java:326)
        at 
org.eclipse.cdt.managedbuilder.ui.properties.BuildOptionListFieldEditor.addPress
ed(BuildOptionListFieldEditor.java:88)
        at 
org.eclipse.cdt.managedbuilder.ui.properties.BuildOptionListFieldEditor$5.widget
Selected(BuildOptionListFieldEditor.java:233)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TypedListener.handleEvent
(TypedListener.java:89)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:81)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:810)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java:1958)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1724)
        at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.runEventLoop(Window.java:583)
        at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.open(Window.java:563)

(PropertyDialogAction.java:164)

(ActionContributionItem.java:456)

(ActionContributionItem.java:403)

(ActionContributionItem.java:397)
        at 
org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem$ActionListener.handleEvent
(ActionContributionItem.java:72)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:81)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:810)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java:1958)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1724)
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:1402)
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:1385)

Fixed by checking return from entry dialog for null. This might be a SWT error 
on Unix, since the entry dialog should just return an empty string ....
